references.citationString: Gianelle, D., Belelli Marchesini, L., Cavagna, M., Marcolla, B., Rodeghiero, M., Vescovo, L., Zampedri, R., ICOS RI, 2021. ICOS ETC Eddy Flux Raw ASCII daily archive, Monte Bondone, 2021-06-19, https://hdl.handle.net/11676/WTT9VwlHA3t0vUf39VJiGRFD

comments: The Monte Bondone station, ICOS code IT-MBo,  is located on a mountain plateau, Viote del Monte Bondone, on eastern Italian Alps (Trentino Alto Adige region) at 1550 m above sea level. The area is managed as an extensive meadow with low mineral fertilisation and is cut annually in mid-July. The canopy is dominated by Festuca rubra (L.), Nardus stricta (L.), and Trifolium sp. (L.).
self.label: IT-MBo

comments: Lands with herbaceous types of cover. Tree and shrub cover is less than 10%. Permanent wetlands lands with a permanent mixture of water and herbaceous or woody vegetation. The vegetation can be present in either salt, brackish, or fresh water.
ecosystemType.label: Grasslands

format.label: Multi-file zip archive with ETC raw time series

self.label: ICOS ETC Eddy Flux Raw ASCII daily archive
